title: Andriy Fedchuk
text: Andriy Vasylyovych Fedchuk (; January 12, 1980 – November 15, 2009), was a <a href="boxing">boxer</a> from <a href="Ukraine">Ukraine</a>, who won the bronze medal in the <a href="light%20heavyweight">light heavyweight</a> division (– 81 kg) at the <a href="2000%20Summer%20Olympics">2000 Summer Olympics</a> in <a href="Sydney%2C%20Australia">Sydney, Australia</a>. In the semifinals he was defeated by eventual runner-up <a href="Rudolf%20Kraj">Rudolf Kraj</a> from the <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech Republic</a>. He also represented his native country at the <a href="2004%20Summer%20Olympics">2004 Summer Olympics</a> in <a href="Athens%2C%20Greece">Athens, Greece</a>, after having won the bronze medal in the same year at the <a href="2004%20European%20Amateur%20Boxing%20Championships">2004 European Amateur Boxing Championships</a> in <a href="Pula%2C%20Croatia">Pula, Croatia</a>. He was born in <a href="Kolomyia">Kolomyia</a>, <a href="Ivano-Frankivsk%20Oblast">Ivano-Frankivsk Oblast</a> and, on November 15, 2009 died in a <a href="traffic%20collision">traffic collision</a> near <a href="Kolomyia">Kolomyia</a>.
